com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCStyledTextBindingData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseBindingData
      • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseTextBindingData
        • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCStyledTextBindingData

  • public class YRCStyledTextBindingData
extends YRCBaseTextBindingData
    Instances of this class provide binding, behavioral and name information about style text controls.
    Usage:
    For binding a style text box one has to create an instance of the class YRCStyledTextBindingData.
    Structure of a sample model used for input: <Orders> <Order OrderNo="1001" OrderStatus="Created" OrderDate="10-31-2005"/> </Orders> //Create a binding object that has to be associated with a control. YRCStyledTextBindingData oStyledTxtData = new YRCStyledTextBindingData(); //Set the name of the control. The control name should be unique. oStyledTxtData.setName("styledTextStatus"); //Set the target binding. By setting the target binding we can use the value in the text box to populate //the entries in the corresponding model. oStyledTxtData.setTargetBinding("/Order/@ChangedStatus"); //Set the source binding. The control will display the value that is present in the model (created using //the behavior object). oStyledTxtData.setSourceBinding("/Orders/Order/@OrderStatus"); * //Finally set the binding data on the control. The key used is: YRCConstants.YRC_TEXT_BINDING_DEFINATION styledTextStatus.setData(YRCConstants.YRC_STYLED_TEXT_BINDING_DEFINATION, oStyledTxtData);
